alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 20 at 12:56PM EST until December 21 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Sagadahoc and Kennebec Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Hallowell. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Businesses in Hallowell and Gardiner flooded. Numerous parking areas flooded from the Kennebec and backwater along the Cobbosseecontee Stream in Gardiner. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:36 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 16.4 feet. - Forecast...Expect moderate flooding to continue through the afternoon as the Kennebec continues to recede. River heights should be down to minor flood stage by this evening. The Kennebec river in Hallowell should exit minor flood stage by tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
